Iraq. The differences weren't personal, Donald Rumsfeld said. He recalled receiving a book that Henry Kissinger had written, with the inscription,`` To an occasional adversary and a permanent friend.'' When I started working on the book, Henry Kissinger said,` You tell it like it was.' We differed on some issues, and there's nothing wrong with that. It was professional and healthy, Donald Rumsfeld said. Working on the book meant second-guessing his memory. was spotted by Tory grandees; in his own profession, so too was Andy Coulson . Possibly apocryphally, Sun editor Kelvin MacKenzie once ordered`` all those people on Bizarre'' should be sacked, before ringing back to say Hang on. You haven't sacked a bloke called Andy Coulson , have you? Get him back. Get him back because Andy Coulson could persuade, and did, Stephen Gately of Boyzone to come out in the Sun as gay. , but rivals are nipping at its heels. The Chrysler Town and Country was the top-selling minivan in the U.S. last year, with sales of 112,275, or about 4,000 more than the Honda Odyssey. We are not going to give up one inch of territory, Sergio Marchionne said. Chrysler said the 2011 versions of its minivans have a new V-6 engine with improved fuel economy. in with` Idol' alongside Simon Cowell and the adorably kooky Paula Abdul , will share the judges panel with Jennifer Lopez and Steven Tyler - high-profile newcomers being counted on to return some much-needed buzz to the aging franchise.
